question.title: Getting failsafe coverage for classes in nested modules
question.body:
I have a repository with multiple projects. There is a project which has all the 'integration-tests' in it. The 'integration-tests' project runs as follows:

  1. Checks if a service is up.
  2. If service is unavailable, launch the service using AnnotationConfigApplicationContext
  3. Runs the tests which basically hits the service endpoint and validates the results.

When I run the tests through failsafe (mvn verify), it gives me only coverage for classes defined in 'integration-test' module. I want the coverage to go deeper and give me the coverage in classes defined in the service.

Ideally I would want all the classes that belong to a certain namespace pattern 'abc.xyz.*'. Things I have tried:

  1. In parent pom.xml, included the above pattern under prepare-agent-integration
  2. Pass in -javagent:../jacocoagent.jar in mvn/jvm.config.

None of these options work. Is it possible to even do this? If so, what can I do to make this work?

answers.body:
I realized what I was doing wrong (or incomplete).
The jacoco-it.exec file that was generated had all the information, but it was not being published to target/site/index.html file for external classes, which was being generated in 'report-integration' goal.

I had to run a separate command using jacococli.jar on the generated .exec file and specify my classfiles and sourcefiles. That gave me the coverage that I was looking for.
